10:01 <camil7> Hi Everyone .... I guess the release of xwiki5.1 is currently in progress, so I wonder if someone has a time to discuss the state of two pull requests, or if I better should return tomorrow.  
10:02 <vmassol> camil7: hi, yeah a bit busy but shoot :) We always like PR! ;)  
10:02 <mflorea> camil7: tomorrow is Bug Fixing Day (every Thursday). Are they bug fixes? :)  
10:03 <camil7> Yes, they are bug fixes ... or should be, at least ;)  
10:03 <camil7> we are not sure if we can fix all problems with them tomorrow  
10:04 <camil7> they are about a bugfix for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7403 (Watchlist mails sometimes in wrong language) ... which seems not to be the fix you expected  
10:05 <camil7> and some Lucene search related fix XWIKI-9232 - well, I wonder if there is still interest in that  
10:10 <tmortagne> camil7: yes for XWIKI-9232 the best would probably to test the new Solr search with the same use case, there has been a lot of work on locales compared to the lucene module  
10:11 <camil7> well, just need to figure out how to set up out outlandish analyzer in that case ... that has been hampering us so far  
10:12 <tmortagne> camil7: for de there is one already  
10:12 <tmortagne> if you have a page in german it will be analyzed as such  
10:14 <tmortagne> camil7: the default Solr setup "generated" by XWiki can be found on https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-search/xwiki-platform-search-solr/xwiki-platform-search-solr-api/src/main/resources/solr  
10:14 <camil7> ah, ok, then its kinda automatically , so no wonder I could not find the configuration options ;)  
10:14 <camil7> ok, looking there, thanks  
10:14 <tmortagne> and more specifically for various supported locales https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-search/xwiki-platform-search-solr/xwiki-platform-search-solr-api/src/main/resources/solr/conf/lang  
10:14 <tmortagne> and once XWiki "installed" Solr you can configure it the way you want or use your own Solr instance  
10:15 <tmortagne> which makes modifications a lot easier  
10:15 <tmortagne> basicaly XWiki is just doing XWiki stuff now ;)  
10:26 <camil7> btw it does not look like the Solr-search has the same problem with hidden document settings, but I better try to see what the query is  
10:28 <tmortagne> camil7: the hidden document information is stored in the Sorl index and depending on your user configuration is filtered or not  
10:29 <camil7> yes, it is just that the query should not flex "hidden:false" to "hidden:fals" in that case, just because it things it should apply German stemming rules  
10:30 <tmortagne> camil7: that field is a "string" which mean no analyze, all analyze is configured field by field in Solr  
10:30 <tmortagne> see https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-search/xwiki-platform-search-solr/xwiki-platform-search-solr-api/src/main/resources/solr/conf/schema.xml  
10:31 <tmortagne> each predefined field has a type  
10:31 <camil7> ah, then I should better not check the query, as no problem, there, but trust Solr not to mess with the field there  
10:31 <tmortagne> and localized fields are store in <fieldprefix>\_<locale> fields  
10:32 <tmortagne> yes now we have to hope Solr does not have bugs since we gave it some stuff we used to do ourself  
10:32 <camil7> actually it "allmoust" works for me, I am just looking why it finds everything but the start page .... local problem for sure ...  
10:36 <camil7> well, thanks for the pointers, I will report back for sure if I find something  
10:36 <vmassol> camil7: I'm looking at https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/116/files now, trying to understand if it's the right fix  
10:37 <vmassol> looks good  
10:37 <vmassol> only worry is that you don't revet it at the end  
10:37 <camil7> vmallso: thanks for looking; I guess we have a  slight disagrement over where the fix should  
10:37 <vmassol> and context isn't cloned  
10:38 <camil7> ah, we thought it is .... but in some level higher up  
10:38 <vmassol> look:  
10:38 <vmassol> in the code htere's:  
10:38 <vmassol> context.setURLFactory(new ExternalServletURLFactory(context));   
10:38 <camil7> then, it maybe should eb cloned again in the method itself to be sure  
10:38 <vmassol> which is correctly put back in a finally block  
10:38 <vmassol> but you added the setLanguage  
10:38 <vmassol> you need to also put back the original one  
10:38 <camil7> ah, or finally block, yes  
10:38 <vmassol> in that finally block  
10:38 <vmassol> as otherwise it'll affect callers  
10:39 <vmassol> since the context isn't cloned  
10:40 <camil7> we have been sure that in the way it is currenlty called via the watchlist plugin the context is cloned by the caller ... but as it is a public method, of course all other possible callers might have a  different ideas about their context  
10:41 <camil7> so we will update the pull request by saving the language and putting it back in the finally block, that should be easy enough ;)  
10:41 <camil7> we just have not figured out how to write tests for that .... need too much components mocking up  
10:41 <tmortagne> camil7: also using Locale based API would be cleaner  
10:42 <tmortagne> setLocale/getLocale  
10:42 <camil7> yes, but we do not get in the locale here .... well, we could fetch a Locale object on our own for the string passed in, but that will just make the code longer, I feel  
10:43 <tmortagne> camil7: mostly talking about the code you will add before and after to save and restore the current locale  
10:43 <camil7> changing the "String lang" in the argument list to a Locale object would be an API change, and I guess that is verboten  
10:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: yes that would need a new API to be perfect since currently the parameter is String language aTM  
10:44 <camil7> ah, ok, now understood, yes ...  
10:44 <camil7> yes, for saving the old locale we can use the setLocale/getLocale, micht also add a comment why this saves the "language", too  
10:46 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <vmassol> camil7: indeed a unit test is not very useful here since it'll just test that setLanguage is called  
10:48 <vmassol> hmm OTOH you cannot mock XWikiVelocityRenderer since it's static apparently  
10:48 <vmassol> (which is bad practice btw, some old code)  
10:49 <vmassol> in practice this could easily be modified to use velocityManager.getVelocityEngine().evaluate  
10:49 <camil7> yes, we also wondered how to avoid actually sending mails when calling  sendMailFromTemplate  
10:50 <vmassol> well you could do an integration test  
10:50 <vmassol> and use greenmail as we use in other tests  
10:50 <camil7> but the velocity renderer, yes, I vaguely remember we ran into that, too  
10:52 <vmassol> but yes it's not easy  
10:52 <vmassol> this is very old code  
10:52 <vmassol> using the old plugin technology  
10:52 <vmassol> this code needs to be rewritten as a component  
10:52 <vmassol> so not sure it's worth the effort for you to write an integration test  
10:53 <camil7> I am not so ready to rewrite this to a component till tomorrow ;)  
10:53 <vmassol> btw tdelafosse do you plan to finish your mail sender component refactoring at some point? :)  
10:53 <vmassol> hehe  
10:53 <vmassol> camil7:  actually tdelafosse started on this  
10:53 <vmassol> but he dropped it AFAIK  
10:54 <camil7> well, if it is ok for you, we will only update the setLocale thing, and try to get away without a test for now  
10:55 <vmassol> yes sounds fine for now  
10:55 <vmassol> :)  
10:55 <camil7> ok, thanks  
10:56 <vmassol> no, thanks to you!  
10:56 <tdelafosse> vmassol : my mail sender works fine, but I'm afraid it needs some refactoring for following the best practice  
10:57 <tdelafosse> I would try to do it this summer  
10:57 <vmassol> ah that would be cool  
10:57 <vmassol> (make sure you verify the language is set correctly ;))

17:49 <tmortagne> the configuration does not have to be in xwiki.cfg you can also put in in XWikiPreferences (but then it's only for the wiki and not the whole farm)  
17:51 <jbwiv> do LDAP groups not show up until the first user who is a member logs in? I was having a lot of problems getting one to show, but after logging in as a user which auth'd against LDAP (and not logging in as Admin) it's suddenly there

17:55 <tmortagne> membership

17:55 <tmortagne> you will only see that user added or removed from the groups  
17:55 <tmortagne> nothing else  
17:55 <jbwiv> ok, so if I want to create a group and shape its permissions, I can do that first, but then add the mapping to that group in the config file later to allow users to get that group up authentication with AD

17:56 <tmortagne> based on the scheduler plugin
